benchmark_details.name: EVDA (EVolving Deepfake Audio Detection)
benchmark_details.overview: EVDA is a benchmark for evaluating continual learning methods in deepfake audio detection, encompassing classic and newly emerging datasets, and supporting various continual learning algorithms.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address the challenges posed by evolving deepfake audio generation techniques using continual learning approaches.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The scope of continual learning methods explored is limited, and the benchmark may not fully capture the diversity of audio deepfakes encountered in practice.

data.source: Various datasets including Anti-Spoofing Voice series and Chinese fake audio detection datasets.

methodology.calculation: EER is calculated to evaluate performance across tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower EER values indicate better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Replay and EWC showed the lowest average EER across tasks.
